[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Center-to-Center (C2C) system defines requirements for traffic data exchange, incident management, and device control across regional traffic centers.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: C2C enables real-time traffic monitoring, ITS control, and multi-agency coordination.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: C2C integrates with ITS systems, management centers, and roadway sensors.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: C2C provides graphical interfaces for operators to monitor and manage traffic conditions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: C2C supports controllers for dynamic message signs, cameras, and traffic signals.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: C2C supports TMDD compliant APIs for inter-agency data sharing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: C2C uses secure TCP/IP for data transmission between agencies.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: C2C optimizes storage for high-speed traffic data processing and retrieval.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: C2C operates 24/7 with scheduled maintenance and data integrity checks.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: C2C is configurable for varying roadway layouts and traffic infrastructure.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: C2C connects to regional traffic data repositories and analytics platforms.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: C2C enables real-time traffic updates, incident response, and automated ITS device control.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Designed for transportation agencies, traffic engineers, and emergency responders.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: C2C relies on ITS networks, sensor accuracy, and multi-agency data sharing.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Incident: Traffic event affecting roadway operations.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: C2C requires TMDD-compatible ITS infrastructure, stable network connections, and real-time telemetry data.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with TMDD for data exchange.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall interface with ITS devices for control.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall manage roadway incident data (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall provide graphical maps for live traffic (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide GUIs with intuitive workflows.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The interface shall support multilingual use.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The database shall securely store traffic incidents and device states.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The database shall support real-time queries and data synchronization.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process traffic updates within 3 seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall handle 10,000 concurrent connections.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The software shall follow modular design principles.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall adhere to ITS and TMDD standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall dynamically scale to handle peak traffic.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall log all critical actions for auditing purposes.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with ITS protocol standards.
[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-002: The system shall meet security and data integrity standards.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Validate traffic updates, incident handling, and compliance with TMDD standards through functional and integration testing.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Setup manuals, operator guides, and TMDD protocols.
[SEC] 5. References: TMDD Standards Documentation, ITS Protocol Guidelines, and Regional Traffic Management Data.
